title: The Teachings and Influence of Lord Buddha | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Tathaskalau sampravrttye sammohaya suradvisham buddho namna anjana sutaha kikateshu bhavishyati
Suta Goswami is speaking in the future tense. Bhavishyati means will appear in the future.
Lord Buddha is a powerful incarnation of the personality of Godhead.
Buddha is an empowered incarnation, shaktiavesha avatara.
Of course for us now, Buddha appeared in the past because 5000 years have elapsed since Kali Yuga began.
So Buddha came about 2500 years back.
He appeared in the province of Gaya, Bihar as a son of Anjana.
At the time when Lord Buddha appeared, the people in general were atheistic
and preferred animosity.
They preferred animosity over the animal flesh.
On the plea of Vedic sacrifice, every place was practically turned into a slaughterhouse.
And animal killing was indulged in unrestrictedly.
Lord Buddha preached non-violence, taking pity on the poor animals.
He preached that he did not believe in the tenets of the Vedas, and stressed the adverse psychological effect of non-violence.
incurred by animal killing. When the Vedas are not accepted through the
authoritative disciplic succession, the casual readers of the
Vedas are misled by the flowery language of that system of knowledge. They have no
depth of knowledge. Now animal killing is specifically allowed in the Vedic
sacrifices to test the power of the mantra being chanted by a particular
Brahman. What is done is an old cow or an old bull is offered in sacrifice but
after that sacrifice the animal is revived. The soul in the animal's body is
getting a new body.
Less intelligent men of the age of Kali who had no faith in God followed the
principle of Lord Buddha and for the time being they were trained in moral
discipline and non-violence, the preliminary steps for proceeding further
on the path of God realization. Lord Buddha deluded the atheists because such
atheists who followed his principle did not believe in God but they kept
their absolute faith in Lord Buddha who himself was the incarnation of God.
According to the Bhagavad Gita Vedascha Sarvair Ahameva Vedyah. The whole system
of the Vedas is to lead one gradually to the path of the Supreme Lord. To know the
Supreme Lord, the individual soul, the cosmic situation and the relation between
all these items.
When the relation is known, the relative function begins. Thus the faithless people
were made to believe in God in the form of Lord Buddha. That was the mercy of Lord Buddha.
He made the faithless faithful to him.
